1330984685992722433 [2020-11-23] @visakanv 💜 1329 🔁 256 💬 10
Can’t sleep, time to do a fresh reboot of VV’s talking points

===

1330992265016213504 [2020-11-23] @visakanv 💜 242 🔁 13 💬 1
10. The public is insufficiently educated on how to be a good public.

You could say that this is the central problem of our species. There are lots of parts to this wicked problem. There’s room for everyone to pitch in and contribute to this infinite endeavor.
↓
1330992873571971072 [2020-11-23] @visakanv 💜 342 🔁 34
11. The means by which the public educates itself (the media, primarily) have warped incentives.

So we have a global public that *systematically* deludes and terrifies itself. Choosing to be a measured, thoughtful, truth-seeking person in this world is a radical & meaningful act
↓
1330993129512607748 [2020-11-23] @visakanv 💜 249 🔁 9 💬 4
12. Solving big problems requires massive coordination. 

As a species we’re not very good at large-scale coordination. To be fair, we’re fairly new to it. We need master communicators and coordinators to demonstrate how we can do it better.
↓
1330993516126695424 [2020-11-23] @visakanv 💜 273 🔁 12
13. Embarking on any sufficiently substantial project - like cooking 100 omelettes - requires that you learn to coordinate and collaborate with your future selves. This is a worthy endeavor because you can subsequently use those skills to serve and help your friends.
↓
1330994322875895808 [2020-11-23] @visakanv 💜 320 🔁 9
14. The core thing about good reply game is attention. You have to be attentive to other people, discern what they’re trying to do, how they’d like to be interacted with. 

Attention is also how you cultivate taste. Attention then is the most precious, valuable resource there is
↓
1330994803920683008 [2020-11-23] @visakanv 💜 205 🔁 14
15. When we coerce people into “paying” attention, we set them up for dysfunctional relationships for the rest of their lives. 

We do this in families, we do this in schools, we do it because it’s convenient and we’re ignorant of the true costs.

See point 6 about bullying
↓
1330995890480300033 [2020-11-23] @visakanv 💜 252 🔁 19 💬 1
16. All advice is context-dependent to a degree we do not realize until we encounter a different context
↓
1330996149591834624 [2020-11-23] @visakanv 💜 226 🔁 16 💬 1
17. Sufficiently caveated advice is indistinguishable from chaos
↓
1330996249793679360 [2020-11-23] @visakanv 💜 244 🔁 28
18. Nothing is edgier than being earnest
↓
1330996509786083328 [2020-11-23] @visakanv 💜 256 🔁 23 💬 8
19. there is no advice that cannot be creatively weaponized in some way to justify getting back on your bullshit
↓

1379066794036486146 [2021-04-05] @nobu_hibiki 💜 10 🔁 1
been thinking about desires and how much "being desired" is a very strong reason to do a lot of things. is this the reason for fame? to be desired?

currently i wish to be desired by people of the opposite that is roughly my age.
↓
1379067081799344128 [2021-04-05] @nobu_hibiki 💜 2 [(SEED) type=quote_of_root]
probably along the line of visa's thought on people wanting to be fuckable more than to fuck

https://t.co/gW08XKujFK
  [Quoting @visakanv: *taps mic*  people wanna be fuckable more than they wanna fuck]
↓
1379067664664915975 [2021-04-05] @nobu_hibiki 💜 2
digging deeper, there's probably a trauma here of me never feeling like i've been desired... but not really. atleast i don't think so.

family was extremely nice, environment was always nice, but it exists? is it possible for this desire to not come from trauma?
↓
1379068087966736387 [2021-04-05] @nobu_hibiki 💜 3
earlier was washing the dishes and felt lonely for some reason. a part of my brain said "yea but you just interacted with people literally 5 minutes ago" but it rebutted instantly with "yea but i started the conversation"

something something wanting to be desired for who i am?
↓
1379068557221191683 [2021-04-05] @nobu_hibiki 💜 4
this is consistent with my experience of making friends and socializing.

zero problems doing it in groups, or when the reason for the conversation is about an *object*. all the problems when i want to talk about *me* and it's not as an *object*
↓
1379069023875330054 [2021-04-05] @nobu_hibiki 💜 3
there's this level of abstraction that happens when im talking about an object or talking within a group. i guess... kinda like a mask? 

was there a time where i wanted to show who i am and got hurt, and as consequences i managed to create a system so that it never happens?
↓
1379069382245052418 [2021-04-05] @nobu_hibiki 💜 2
is this the reason why my desire for gf is irrational? it doesn't come from anywhere, other than the fact that i need it.

like a prophecy, it is my heart telling me what i need in order to... idk, unlock? something? maybe?

rating.reasoning_summary: This strand centers on a single viral aphorism ('people wanna be fuckable more than they wanna fuck') that serves as a conceptual boundary object for exploring status, desire, and social performance. The arc spans 6 years (2019-2025), evolving from a throwaway observation about sexual capital into a flexible framework applied to dating apps, incels, power dynamics, and even non-sexual domains (sonder, Christmas). The discourse is primarily **constructive**—people riff on and extend the core insight rather than attacking it. The idea demonstrates high **memetic fitness** (repeatedly quoted/remixed) and moderate **conceptual evolution** (from sex → fuckability-as-capital → status anxiety → mimetic desire). However, it remains largely a **diagnostic tool** rather than producing actionable solutions or institutional change.

essential_tweets.annotation: The Origin: Visa's viral seed tweet establishing the core aphorism (2019)
First Major Refinement: 'fucking is labor, fuckability is capital' - introducing economic framing
Canonical Restatement: Visa includes it in his 'best one-liners' thread, cementing its status
Qiaochu's Extension: Linking to 'sex is about everything except sex' - broadening scope
Yash's Dialectic: 'broad legible fuckability vs specific individual desire' - key distinction
Yash's Escalation: Dating apps create zero-sum fuckability competition (2024)
Yash's Synthesis: 'Fuckability=getting an A, fucking=real application' - schoolwork metaphor
Eshear's Generalization: 'People want to have power more than wield it' - abstraction to capital/labor
Yash's Meta-Analysis: Fuckability is for the audience, fucking is for the partner - core tension
Full Circle: VividVoid inverts the original ('need to fuck more than be fuckable') - prescriptive turn
